definition: (of an expectant mother) to be in labor
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to

sentences.english: How would you like to see a horse being born?
sentences.chinese: 你如何能看出一匹馬要待產？

sentences.english: I would like to be able to have fluids by mouth throughout the first stage of labor.
sentences.chinese: 我希望能在待產的第一階段自己進一些流食。

sentences.english: Normally, a woman will lie in a few hours before the birth of her child.
sentences.chinese: 在一般情況下，孕婦在分娩前幾個小時要臥牀待產。

sentences.english: She lay in about 3 hours before the birth of the baby.
sentences.chinese: 分娩前她臥牀待產三個小時。

sentences.english: A fairly large proportion of expectant mothers are crowded out of Britain's maternity hospitals.
sentences.chinese: 相當多的待產婦被擠出英國產科醫院。

definition: two simultaneous happy events in the family
to heave a sigh of relief
widely spread/widely rumored/stories abound/(sb's exploits are) widely circulated
expected date of childbirth/estimated due date (EDD)
public courtroom accusation (idiom)/legal confrontation/to take sb to court/to sue
abbr. for 產前檢查|产前检查[chan3 qian2 jian3 cha2]
